member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.RestBase.SendRequest(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Sends a request through the REST API to Facebook. This is what the other methods all use to communicate with Facebook. You should only use this method if you need to call a method that is not defined in this toolkit. This method will always use the session key in the request.
member.param: A dictionary of parameters for the method being called, as specified in the documentation for the method. You will need to make sure to have a parameter named "method" corresponding to the method name. The toolkit will populate the api_key, call_id, sig, v, and session_key parameters.
member.returns: The XML response returned by Facebook.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.RestBase.SendRequest(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sends a request through the REST API to Facebook. This is what the other methods all use to communicate with Facebook. You should only use this method if you need to call a method that is not defined in this toolkit.
member.param: A dictionary of parameters for the method being called, as specified in the documentation for the method. You will need to make sure to have a parameter named "method" corresponding to the method name. The toolkit will populate the api_key, call_id, sig, v, and session_key parameters.
Whether or not to use the session key in the request.
member.returns: The XML response returned by Facebook.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Friends.AreFriends(System.Collections.Generic.List{FacebookToolkit.Schema.user},System.Collections.Generic.List{FacebookToolkit.Schema.user})
member.summary: Returns whether or not each pair of specified users is friends with each other.
member.param: A list of user ids matched with uids2.
A list of user ids matched with uids1.
member.returns: Returns a list of friend_info elements corresponding to the lists passed. The are_friends subelement of each friend_info element is 0 or false if the users are not friends, and 1 or true if they are friends. Note that, for each pair, this function is symmetric. That is, it does not matter which user is in uids1 and which is in uids2.
member.remarks: The first array specifies one half of each pair, the second array the other half; therefore, they must be of equal size.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Friends.Get
member.summary: Returns the identifiers for the current user's Facebook friends.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Friends.Get();

member.returns: The List of friend IDs returned are the friends that are visible to the Facebook Platform. If no friends are found, the method returns an empty friends_get_response element.
member.remarks: The first array specifies one half of each pair, the second array the other half; therefore, they must be of equal size.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Friends.Get(System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns the identifiers for the current user's Facebook friends.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Friends.Get(Constants.UserId);

member.param: The user ID for the user whose friends you want to return.
member.returns: The List of friend IDs returned are the friends that are visible to the Facebook Platform. If no friends are found, the method returns an empty friends_get_response element.
member.remarks: The first array specifies one half of each pair, the second array the other half; therefore, they must be of equal size.

Returns the friends in a friend list.
member.returns: The List of friend IDs returned are the friends that are visible to the Facebook Platform. If no friends are found, the method returns an empty friends_get_response element.
member.remarks: The first array specifies one half of each pair, the second array the other half; therefore, they must be of equal size.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Friends.GetAppUsers
member.summary: Returns the identifiers for the current user's Facebook friends who have authorized the specific calling application.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Friends.GetAppUsers();

member.returns: The friend IDs returned are those friends who have authorized the calling application, which is a subset of the friends returned from the friends.get method. If no friends are found, the method returns an empty friends_getAppUsers_response element.
member.remarks: The first array specifies one half of each pair, the second array the other half; therefore, they must be of equal size.

member.returns: This method returns an List of user IDs of the mutual friends, or an error code.
member.remarks: The first array specifies one half of each pair, the second array the other half; therefore, they must be of equal size.

member.name: T:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Users
member.summary: Facebook Users API methods.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Users.#ctor(FacebookToolkit.Session.FacebookSession)
member.summary: Public constructor for facebook.Users
member.param: Needs a connected Facebook Session object for making requests

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Users.GetInfo
member.summary: Returns a wide array of user-specific information for each user identifier passed, limited by the view of the current user.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); api.Users.GetInfo();

member.returns: The user info elements returned are those friends visible to the Facebook Platform. If no visible users are found from the passed uids argument, the method will return an empty result element.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Users.GetInfo(System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns a wide array of user-specific information for each user identifier passed, limited by the view of the current user.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var actual = api.Users.GetInfo(Constants.UserId);

member.param: A user ID.
member.returns: The user info elements returned are those friends visible to the Facebook Platform. If no visible users are found from the passed uids argument, the method will return an empty result element.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Users.GetInfo(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64})
member.summary: Returns a wide array of user-specific information for each user identifier passed, limited by the view of the current user.
member.param: This is a List of user IDs.
member.returns: The user info elements returned are those friends visible to the Facebook Platform. If no visible users are found from the passed uids argument, the method will return an empty result element.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Users.GetStandardInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Returns an array of user-specific information for use by the application itself.
member.param: A comma-separated list of user IDs.
member.returns: The user info elements returned are those friends visible to the Facebook Platform.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Users.GetStandardInfo(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64})
member.summary: Returns an array of user-specific information for use by the application itself.
member.param: A List of user IDs.
member.returns: The user info elements returned are those friends visible to the Facebook Platform.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Users.GetStandardInfo(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64},System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.String})
member.summary: Returns an array of user-specific information for use by the application itself.
member.param: A List of user IDs.

List of desired fields in return. This is a List of field strings and is limited to these entries only: uid, first_name, last_name, name, timezone, birthday, sex, affiliations (regional type only), locale, profile_url, proxied_email.
member.returns: The user info elements returned are those friends visible to the Facebook Platform.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Users.GetStandardInfo(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.String})
member.summary: Returns an array of user-specific information for use by the application itself.
member.param: A comma-separated list of user IDs.

List of desired fields in return. This is a List of field strings and is limited to these entries only: uid, first_name, last_name, name, timezone, birthday, sex, affiliations (regional type only), locale, profile_url, proxied_email.
member.returns: The user info elements returned are those friends visible to the Facebook Platform.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Users.GetLoggedInUser
member.summary: Gets the user ID (uid) associated with the current session.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Users.GetLoggedInUser();

member.returns: This method returns the user ID (uid) associated with the current session.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Users.HasAppPermission(FacebookToolkit.Schema.Enums.ExtendedPermissions)
member.summary: Checks whether the user has opted in to an extended application permission.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Users.HasAppPermission(Enums.ExtendedPermissions.email);

member.param: String identifier for the extended permission that is being checked for. Must be one of email, read_stream, publish_stream, offline_access, status_update, photo_upload, {create_event, rsvp_event, sms, video_upload, create_note, share_item.
member.returns: Returns true or false.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Users.HasAppPermission(FacebookToolkit.Schema.Enums.ExtendedPermissions,System.Int64)
member.summary: Checks whether the user has opted in to an extended application permission.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Users.HasAppPermission(Enums.ExtendedPermissions.email, Constants.UserId);

member.param: String identifier for the extended permission that is being checked for. Must be one of email, read_stream, publish_stream, offline_access, status_update, photo_upload, {create_event, rsvp_event, sms, video_upload, create_note, share_item.

The user ID of the user whose permissions you are checking. If this parameter is not specified, then it defaults to the session user. Note: This parameter applies only to Web applications. Facebook ignores this parameter if it is passed by a desktop application.
member.returns: Returns true or false.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Users.IsAppUser(System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns whether the user (either the session user or user specified by UID) has authorized the calling application.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Users.IsAppUser(Constants.UserId);

member.param: The user ID of the user who may have authorized the application. If this parameter is not specified, then it defaults to the session user. Note: This parameter applies only to Web applications. Facebook ignores this parameter if it is passed by a desktop application.
member.returns: Returns true or false.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Users.IsVerified(System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns whether the user is a verified Facebook user.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Users.IsVerified(Constants.UserId);

member.param: The user ID to verify.
member.returns: This call returns true for a verified user; false for an non-verified user.
member.remarks: This method is currently broken on Facebook's side (it only returns an empty XML element). A bug report has been filed here: http://bugs.developers.facebook.com/show_bug.cgi?id=5129 .

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Users.SetStatus(System.String)
member.summary: Updates a user's Facebook status.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Users.SetStatus("I'm a code sample.");

member.param: The status message to set. Note: The maximum message length is 255 characters; messages longer than that limit will be truncated and appended with '...'.
member.returns: This method returns true on success, false on failure, or an error code.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Users.SetStatus(System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: Updates a user's Facebook status.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Users.SetStatus("I'm a code sample.", Constants.UserId);

member.param: The status message to set. Note: The maximum message length is 255 characters; messages longer than that limit will be truncated and appended with '...'.

The user ID of the user whose status you are setting. If this parameter is not specified, then it defaults to the session user. Note: This parameter applies only to Web applications. Facebook ignores this parameter if it is passed by a desktop application.
member.returns: This method returns true on success, false on failure, or an error code.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Users.SetStatus(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates a user's Facebook status.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Users.SetStatus("I'm a code sample.", true);

member.param: The status message to set. Note: The maximum message length is 255 characters; messages longer than that limit will be truncated and appended with '...'.
If set to true, the word "is" will not be prepended to the status message.
member.returns: This method returns true on success, false on failure, or an error code.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Users.SetStatus(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int64)
member.summary: Updates a user's Facebook status.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Users.SetStatus("I'm a code sample.", true, Constants.UserId);

member.param: The status message to set. Note: The maximum message length is 255 characters; messages longer than that limit will be truncated and appended with '...'.
If set to true, the word "is" will not be prepended to the status message.

The user ID of the user whose status you are setting. If this parameter is not specified, then it defaults to the session user. Note: This parameter applies only to Web applications. Facebook ignores this parameter if it is passed by a desktop application.
member.returns: This method returns true on success, false on failure, or an error code.

member.name: T:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Fql
member.summary: Facebook Fql API methods.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Fql.#ctor(FacebookToolkit.Session.FacebookSession)
member.summary: Public constructor for facebook.Fql
member.param: Needs a connected Facebook Session object for making requests

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Fql.Query(System.String)
member.summary: Evaluates an FQL (Facebook Query Language) query.
member.param: The query to perform, as described in the FQL documentation.
member.returns: This method returns data that very closely resembles the returns of other API calls like users.getInfo. This is not a coincidence - in fact, many of the other API functions are simply wrappers for FQL queries. Note that it preserves the order of the fields in your SELECT clause and that it can contain multiple elements with the same name depending on how you structure the query.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Fql.Query``1(System.String)
member.summary: Evaluates an FQL (Facebook Query Language) query.
member.param: The query to perform, as described in the FQL documentation.
member.returns: This method returns data that very closely resembles the returns of other API calls like users.getInfo. This is not a coincidence - in fact, many of the other API functions are simply wrappers for FQL queries. Note that it preserves the order of the fields in your SELECT clause and that it can contain multiple elements with the same name depending on how you structure the query.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Fql.Multiquery(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Evaluates a series of FQL (Facebook Query Language) queries in one call and returns the data at one time.
member.param: A collection of the queries to perform. The array contains a set of key/value pairs. Each key is a query name, which can contain only alphanumeric characters and optional underscores. Each key maps to a value containing a traditional FQL query.
member.returns: This call returns a List of query results. The keys returned are the names of the queries made. As with fql.query, the data returned from each query very closely resembles the returns of other API calls like users.getInfo, as many API functions are simply wrappers for FQL queries.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Utility.Utilities.GenerateEmailHash(System.String)
member.summary: Converts email address to Facebook Connect-formatted email hash using Facebook-specified hashing rules.
member.param: The email address to apply hash.
member.returns: A Facebook email hash.
member.remarks: Compute the email_hash property as follows: Normalize the email address. Trim leading and trailing whitespace, and convert all characters to lowercase. Compute the CRC32 value for the normalized email address and use the unsigned integer representation of this value. (Note that some implementations return signed integers, in which case you will need to convert that result to an unsigned integer.) Compute the MD5 value for the normalized email address and use the hex representation of this value (using lowercase for A through F). Combine these two value with an underscore. For example, the address mary@example.com converts to 4228600737_c96da02bba97aedfd26136e980ae3761.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Photos.AddTag(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int64},System.String,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Adds a tag with the given information to a photo.
member.param: The photo id of the photo to be tagged.
The user id of the user being tagged. Either tag_uid or tag_text must be specified.
Some text identifying the person being tagged. Either tag_uid or tag_text must be specified. This parameter is ignored if tag_uid is specified.
The horizontal position of the tag, as a percentage from 0 to 100, from the left of the photo.
The vertical position of the tag, as a percentage from 0 to 100, from the top of the photo.
member.remarks: Tags can only be added to pending photos owned by the current session user. Once a photo has been approved or rejected, it can no longer be tagged with this method. There is a limit of 20 tags per pending photo.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Photos.Get(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Returns all visible photos according to the filters specified.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Photos.Get(string.Empty, Constants.AlbumId.ToString(), null);

member.param: Filter by photos tagged with this user.
Filter by photos in this album.
Filter by photos in this list. This is a comma-separated list of pids.
member.returns: This method returns all visible photos satisfying the filters specified. The method can be used to return all photos tagged with user, in an album, query a specific set of photos by a list of pids, or filter on any combination of these three.
member.remarks: It is an error to omit all three of the subj_id, aid, and pids parameters. They have no defaults.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Photos.GetTags(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Returns the set of user tags on all photos specified.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Photos.GetTags(new List<string> { Constants.PhotoId });

member.param: The list of photos from which to extract photo tags.
member.returns: If no photo tags are found, the method will return an empty photos_getTags_response element. Text tags not corresponding to a user are not currently returned. Some tags may be text-only and will have an empty subect element. This occurs in the case where a user did not specifically tag another account, but just supplied text information.
member.remarks: A tag of a user will be visible to an application only if that user has not turned off access to the Facebook Platform.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Photos.Upload(System.String,System.String,System.IO.FileInfo)
member.summary: Uploads a photo owned by the current session user and returns the new photo.
member.param: Optional - The album id of the destination album.
Optional - The caption of the photo.
The raw image data for the photo.
member.returns: Photo information, including the photo URL.
member.remarks: If no album is specified, the photo will be uploaded to a default album for the application, which will be created if necessary. Regular albums have a size limit of 60 photos. Default application albums have a size limit of 1000 photos. It is strongly recommended that you scale the image in your application before adding it to the request. The largest dimension should be at most 604 pixels (the largest display size Facebook supports).

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Photos.GetAlbums
member.summary: Returns metadata about all of the photo albums uploaded by the specified user.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Photos.GetAlbums();

member.returns: This method returns all visible photos satisfying the filters specified. The method can be used to return all photo albums created by a user, query a specific set of albums by a list of aids, or filter on any combination of these two. The album ids returned by this function can be passed in to facebook.photos.get.
member.remarks: It is an error to omit both of the uid and aids parameters. They have no defaults. In this call, an album owned by a user will be returned to an application if that user has not turned off access to the Facbook Platform.

Default application albums have a size limit of 1000 photos. It is strongly recommended that you scale the image in your application before adding it to the request. The largest dimension should be at most 604 pixels (the largest display size Facebook supports).

The raw image data for the photo.
One of the image file types

Default application albums have a size limit of 1000 photos. It is strongly recommended that you scale the image in your application before adding it to the request. The largest dimension should be at most 604 pixels (the largest display size Facebook supports).

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Connect.UnregisterUsers(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Unregisters a previously registered account (using connect.registerUsers). You should call this method if the user deletes his or her account on your site. (for Facebook Connect).
member.param: An array of email_hashes to unregister.
member.returns: This method returns a List of unregistered email hashes. If any email hashes are missing, we recommend that you try unregistering the account again later.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Connect.RegisterUsers(System.Collections.Generic.List{FacebookToolkit.Rest.ConnectAccountMap})
member.summary: Creates an association between an existing user account on your site and that user's Facebook account, provided the user has not connected accounts before (for Facebook Connect).
member.param: An array of up to 1,000 arrays, or "maps," where each map represent a connected account.
member.returns: This method returns a List email hashes that have been successfully registered. If any email hashes are missing, we recommend that you try registering them again later.

member.name: T:FacebookToolkit.Rest.ConnectAccountMap
member.summary: A helper object to store one Facebook Connect account map, where each map represents one Facebook Connect site email address and one of two optional Account identifiers. This object is used to register third-party accounts with existing Facebook accounts.

member.name: P:FacebookToolkit.Rest.ConnectAccountMap.EmailAddress
member.summary: The email account of the remote (Connect site) account.

member.name: P:FacebookToolkit.Rest.ConnectAccountMap.AccountId
member.summary: Optional: The user's account ID on the Facebook Connect site. If you specify the AccountId property, then you must also set a Connect Preview URL in your application's settings in order to generate a full user URL. The Connect Preview URL contains an AccountId parameter, such as http://www.example.com/profile.php?user=AccountId.

member.name: P:FacebookToolkit.Rest.ConnectAccountMap.AccountUrl
member.summary: Optional: The URL to the user's account on the Facebook Connect site. If you specify the AccountUrl property, that URL will be used directly. Facebook recommends that you specify at least one of either the AccountId or the AccountUrl properties.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Feed.#ctor(FacebookToolkit.Session.FacebookSession)
member.summary: Public constructor for facebook.Feed
member.param: Needs a connected Facebook Session object for making requests

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Feed.PublishTemplatizedAction(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection{FacebookToolkit.Schema.feed_image})
member.summary: Publishes a Mini-Feed story to the Facebook Page corresponding to the page_actor_id parameter.
member.param: The templatized markup displayed in the feed story's title section. This template must contain the token {actor} somewhere in it.

Optional - A collection of the values that should be substituted into the templates in the title_template markup string. The keys of this array are the tokens, and their associated values are the desired substitutions. 'actor' and 'target' are special tokens and should not be included in this array. If your title_template contains tokens besides 'actor' and 'target', then this is a required parameter.
Optional - The markup displayed in the feed story's body section.

Optional - A collection of the values that should be substituted into the templates in the body_template markup string. The keys of this array are the tokens, and their associated values are the desired substitutions. 'actor' and 'target' are special token and should not be included in this array.

Optional - A collection of images to be displayed in the Feed story. Similar to body_general, the image displayed is not aggregated -- the image from any one of the aggregated stories may be displayed.
member.returns: The function returns true on success, false on permissions error, or an error response.
member.remarks: This method is deprecated for actions taken by users only; it still works for actions taken by Facebook Pages.

member.summary: Publishes a Mini-Feed story to the Facebook Page corresponding to the page_actor_id parameter.
member.param: The templatized markup displayed in the feed story's title section. This template must contain the token {actor} somewhere in it.

Optional - A collection of the values that should be substituted into the templates in the title_template markup string. The keys of this array are the tokens, and their associated values are the desired substitutions. 'actor' and 'target' are special tokens and should not be included in this array. If your title_template contains tokens besides 'actor' and 'target', then this is a required parameter.
Optional - The markup displayed in the feed story's body section.

Optional - A collection of the values that should be substituted into the templates in the body_template markup string. The keys of this array are the tokens, and their associated values are the desired substitutions. 'actor' and 'target' are special token and should not be included in this array.
Optional - Additional markup displayed in the feed story's body section. This markup is not required to be identical for two stories to be aggregated. One of the two will be chosen at random.

Optional - if publishing a story to a Facebook Page, use this parameter as the page who performed the action. If you use this parameter, the application must be added to that Page's Feed. A session key is not required to do this.

Optional - A collection of images to be displayed in the Feed story. Similar to body_general, the image displayed is not aggregated -- the image from any one of the aggregated stories may be displayed.

Optional - A collection of IDs of friends of the actor, used for stories about a direct action between the actor and these targets of his/her action. This is required if either the title_template or body_template includes the token {target}.
member.returns: The function returns true on success, false on permissions error, or an error response.
member.remarks: This method is deprecated for actions taken by users only; it still works for actions taken by Facebook Pages.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Feed.DeactivateTemplateBundleByID(System.String)
member.summary: Deactivates a previously registered template bundle.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Feed.DeactivateTemplateBundleByID(Constants.TemplateBundleId);

member.param: The template bundle ID used to identify a previously registered template bundle. The ID is the one returned by a previous call to Feed.RegisterTemplateBundle.
member.returns: This method returns true if the specified template was deactivated.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Feed.GetRegisteredTemplateBundleByID(System.Int64)
member.summary: Retrieves information about a specified template bundle previously registered by the requesting application.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Feed.GetRegisteredTemplateBundleByID(long.Parse(Constants.TemplateBundleId));

member.param: The template bundle ID used to identify a previously registered template bundle. The ID is the one returned by a previous call to Feed.RegisterTemplateBundle.
member.returns: This method returns a template_bundle containing information on the specified template bundle ID.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Feed.GetRegisteredTemplateBundles
member.summary: Retrieves the full list of all the template bundles registered by the requesting application.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Feed.GetRegisteredTemplateBundles();

member.returns: This method returns a List of template_bundles.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Feed.RegisterTemplateBundle(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Collections.Generic.List{FacebookToolkit.Rest.feedTemplate},FacebookToolkit.Rest.feedTemplate)
member.summary: Builds a template bundle around the specified templates, registers them on Facebook, and responds with a template bundle ID that can be used to identify your template bundle to other Feed-related API calls.
member.param: array containing one FBML template that can be used to render one line Feed stories
Array of short story templates
template for a single full story
member.returns: This method returns an identifier that the developer can use to publish actual stories using that template bundle.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Feed.RegisterTemplateBundle(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Collections.Generic.List{FacebookToolkit.Rest.feedTemplate},FacebookToolkit.Rest.feedTemplate,System.Collections.Generic.IList{FacebookToolkit.Schema.action_link})
member.summary: Builds a template bundle around the specified templates, registers them on Facebook, and responds with a template bundle ID that can be used to identify your template bundle to other Feed-related API calls.
member.param: array containing one FBML template that can be used to render one line Feed stories
Array of short story templates
template for a single full story
Array of action link records
member.returns: This method returns an identifier that the developer can use to publish actual stories using that template bundle.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Feed.PublishUserAction(System.Int64,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64},System.String,FacebookToolkit.Rest.Feed.PublishedStorySize)
member.summary: Publishes a story on behalf of the user owning the session, using the specified template bundle.
member.param: The template bundle ID used to identify a previously registered template bundle. The ID is the one returned by a previous call to feed.registerTemplateBundle or when you registered the bundle using the Feed Template Console.
A collection of the values that should be substituted into the templates held by the specified template bundle. For information on forming the template_data object, see Facebook API Documentation.

A list of IDs of friends of the actor, used for stories about a direct action between the actor and the targets of his or her action. This parameter is required if one or more templates in the template bundle makes use of the {*target*} token. It should only include the IDs of friends of the actor, and it should not contain the actor's ID.
Additional markup that extends the body of a short story.

The size of the Feed story. The one line story is the default, and users have to opt into using short stories at time of publication or through their privacy settings. Otherwise, if the user has not allowed that particular size to be published through the API, then the story size will be demoted to match the user's preference.
member.returns: The function returns true on success or an error response.
member.remarks:
http://wiki.developers.facebook.com/index.php/Feed.publishUserAction Publishes a story on behalf of the user owning the session, using the specified template bundle. An application can publish a maximum of 10 stories per user per day You can test your Feed templates using the Feed preview console (cf above wiki post).
Use JSONHelper.ConvertToJSONArray and/or JSONHelper.ConvertToJSONAssociativeArray to add 'subarrays' in template_data
Reserved tokens in template_data: actor target
Special tokens in template_data: images: array of image. image: src, (optional)href flash: swfsrc, imgsrc, (optional)expanded_width, (optional)expanded_height mp3: src, (optional)title, (optional)artist, (optional)album video: video_src, preview_img, (optional)video_title, (optional)video_link, (optional)video_type (default:application/x-shockwave-flash)

member.summary: Publishes a Mini-Feed story to the Facebook Page corresponding to the page_actor_id parameter.
member.param: The templatized markup displayed in the feed story's title section. This template must contain the token {actor} somewhere in it.

Optional - A collection of the values that should be substituted into the templates in the title_template markup string. The keys of this array are the tokens, and their associated values are the desired substitutions. 'actor' and 'target' are special tokens and should not be included in this array. If your title_template contains tokens besides 'actor' and 'target', then this is a required parameter.
Optional - The markup displayed in the feed story's body section.

Optional - A collection of the values that should be substituted into the templates in the body_template markup string. The keys of this array are the tokens, and their associated values are the desired substitutions. 'actor' and 'target' are special token and should not be included in this array.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Intl.GetTranslations(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns an array of strings from your application that you submitted for translation. This call returns the original native strings, the best (or all) translations of native strings into a given locale, whether the string has been approved, and by whom. By default, the translation for a given string that gets returned is the current best translation, as it appears in the Facebook Translations application database. The translation was approved either automatically by the Translations application or was manually approved by you, another developer of your application, or a translator with whom you have a contract. If there is no such translation, then the native string doesn't get returned. You do not have to pass a session key with this method. However, you must include your application secret.
member.param: The locale from where you are retrieving the translated strings. To return translated strings from every locale where someone has translated your application, specify all for locale (however, this is not recommended for performance reasons). Locales are of the format ll_CC, where ll is a two-letter language code (in lowercase), and CC is a two-letter country code (in uppercase). For a list of locales Facebook supports, see Facebook Locales. If the default is used, then only the native strings get returned. (Default value is en_US.)
When true, this call returns every translation for every native string. When false, this call returns the best translation for every native string. (Default value is false.)

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Intl.UploadNativeStrings(System.Collections.Generic.List{FacebookToolkit.Rest.native_string})
member.summary: Lets you insert text strings in their native language into the Facebook Translations database so they can be translated. See Translating Platform Applications for more information about translating your applications.
member.param: A JSON-encoded array of strings to translate. Each element of the string array is an object, with text storing the actual string, description storing the description of the text.
member.returns: If successful, this method returns the number of strings uploaded.

member.param: The locale from where you are retrieving the translated strings. For a list of locales Facebook supports, see Facebook Locales. If the default is used, then only the native strings get returned. (Default value is en_US.)

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.AddGlobalNews(FacebookToolkit.Schema.dashboard_news)
member.summary: This method creates one or more global news items, which appear in the dashboards of all your users. You can use this to announce new features to your users, for example. Calling this method appends the news items included in this call to the news stream. Facebook displays up to two news items (whether personal or global, or both) at a time for a given application, starting from the two most recently added. If a user authorizes your application and you have previously added any global news items, then the most recently set global news items appear on the new user's dashboard. This method does not take a session key. You must sign this call with your application secret. Applications that should not include their application secret in their code (such as desktop applications), should not make this call.
member.param: An array containing between 1 and 8 news item objects. Each news item object is an object that contains the following: message (required): This is a text-only string containing the content of the activity. You can include one {*actor*} token, which is the same token used in stream attachments. When the news is published, Facebook replaces this token with the full name of the current session user. Note: The message gets truncated after 50 characters, including any user name referenced. action_link: An associative array containing an action link text and URL. The action link appears after the message and follows the same guidelines as action links in stream stories. text: The text of the action link, which gets truncated after 25 characters. href: The URL of the action link. image:The absolute URL to the image associated with the array of news items. Facebook formats the image as a 64x64 pixel square. This image cannot be a Facebook.com URL. If you don't specify an image, Facebook displays your application logo instead.
member.returns: This method returns an int containing a news_id if the call succeeds. It returns false if it doesn't succeed and, if the call is malformed, may return an error code.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.AddNews(FacebookToolkit.Schema.dashboard_news,System.Int64)
member.summary: This method adds personal news from your application for the specified user. Calling this method appends the news items included in this call to the news stream. Facebook displays up to two news items (either personal, global, or both) at a time for a given application, starting from the two most recently added. When calling this method, you must do one of the following: Sign your call with a session secret and include a valid session key for the logged-in user. Specify a user ID and sign the call with your application secret. Applications that should not include their application secret in their code (such as desktop applications), should sign the call with a session secret and include a valid session key.
member.param: An array containing between 1 and 8 news item objects. Each news item object is an object that contains the following: message (required): This is a text-only string containing the content of the activity. You can include one {*actor*} token, which is the same token used in stream attachments. When the news is published, Facebook replaces this token with the full name of the current session user. Note: The message gets truncated after 50 characters, including any user name referenced. action_link: An associative array containing an action link text and URL. The action link appears after the message and follows the same guidelines as action links in stream stories. text: The text of the action link, which gets truncated after 25 characters. href: The URL of the action link. image:The absolute URL to the image associated with the array of news items. Facebook formats the image as a 64x64 pixel square. This image cannot be a Facebook.com URL. If you don't specify an image, Facebook displays your application logo instead.

The ID of the user whose dashboard you are updating. If you include the uid, you must sign your call with your application secret. If you do not include the uid, you must include a session key and sign your call with a session secret.
member.returns: This method returns an int containing a news_id if the call succeeds

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.MultiAddNews(FacebookToolkit.Schema.dashboard_news,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64})
member.summary: This method adds personal news from your application for an array of users. Calling this method appends the news items included in this call to the news stream. Facebook displays up to two news items (either personal or global) at a time for a given application, starting from the two most recently added. This method does not take a session key. You must sign this call with your application secret. Applications that should not include their application secret in their code (such as desktop applications), should not make this call.
member.param: An array containing between 1 and 8 news item objects. Each news item object is an object that contains the following: message (required): This is a text-only string containing the content of the activity. You can include one {*actor*} token, which is the same token used in stream attachments. When the news is published, Facebook replaces this token with the full name of the current session user. Note: The message gets truncated after 50 characters, including any user name referenced. action_link: An associative array containing an action link text and URL. The action link appears after the message and follows the same guidelines as action links in stream stories. text: The text of the action link, which gets truncated after 25 characters. href: The URL of the action link. image:The absolute URL to the image associated with the array of news items. Facebook formats the image as a 64x64 pixel square. This image cannot be a Facebook.com URL. If you don't specify an image, Facebook displays your application logo instead.
An array of IDs of the users whose dashboards you are updating.
member.returns: This method returns an associative array of key/value pairs, where each key is the UID of the user whose news was set, and the value is either the ID of the news item, or false if the new wasn't set.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.MultiDecrementCount(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64})
member.summary: This method decreases your application's dashboard counter by 1 for an array of users. This method does not take a session key. You must sign this call with your application secret. Applications that should not include their application secret in their code (such as desktop applications), should not make this call.
member.param: An array of IDs of the users whose counters you are decrementing.
member.returns: This method returns an array of key/value pairs, where the key is the user ID and the value is a boolean indicating whether or not the counter was decremented successfully. Note: Decrementing a counter currently set to 0 will return false.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.MultiIncrementCount(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64})
member.summary: This method increases your application's dashboard counter by 1 for an array of users. As per the Platform Principles and Policy, you must use the counter only to inform users about legitimate actions that they should take within your application, and must not use the counter for promotional or marketing purposes. You should increment the counter only once for each item or action about which you need to notify a user. This method does not take a session key. You must sign this call with your application secret. Applications that should not include their application secret in their code (such as desktop applications), should not make this call.
member.param: An array of IDs of the users whose counters you are incrementing.
member.returns: This method returns an array of key/value pairs, where the key is user ID and the value is a boolean indicating whether or not the counter was incremented successfully.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.MultiGetCount(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64})
member.summary: This method returns the current value for your application's dashboard counter for an array of users. This method does not take a session key. You must sign this call with your application secret. Applications that should not include their application secret in their code (such as desktop applications), should not make this call.
member.param: An array of IDs of the users whose counters you are retrieving.
member.returns: This method returns an associative array containing key/value pairs, where the key is the user ID and the value is an int containing the current value for the counter.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.MultiSetCount(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Int64,System.Int64})
member.summary: This method sets your application's dashboard counter for an array of users. You can use this method to set a user's counter to 0, effectively clearing it. As per the Platform Principles and Policy, you must use the counter only to inform users about legitimate actions that they should take within your application, and must not use the counter for promotional or marketing purposes. You should increment the counter only once for each item or action about which you need to notify a user. This method does not take a session key. You must sign this call with your application secret. Applications that should not include their application secret in their code (such as desktop applications), should not make this call.
member.param: An array containing between 1 and 8 news item objects. Each news item object is an object that contains the following: message (required): This is a text-only string containing the content of the activity. You can include one {*actor*} token, which is the same token used in stream attachments. When the news is published, Facebook replaces this token with the full name of the current session user. Note: The message gets truncated after 50 characters, including any user name referenced. action_link: An associative array containing an action link text and URL. The action link appears after the message and follows the same guidelines as action links in stream stories. text: The text of the action link, which gets truncated after 25 characters. href: The URL of the action link. image:The absolute URL to the image associated with the array of news items. Facebook formats the image as a 64x64 pixel square. This image cannot be a Facebook.com URL. If you don't specify an image, Facebook displays your application logo instead.
member.returns: This method returns an array of key/value pairs, where the key is user ID and the value is a boolean indicating whether or not the counter was set successfully.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.MultiClearNews(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Int64,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String}})
member.summary: This method removes some or all of your application's personal news items for an array of users. Calling this method does not remove any existing global news items, so existing global news item(s) set with dashboard.addGlobalNews will appear again. To remove all news items for a user, call this method and dashboard.clearGlobalNews for each user. This method does not take a session key. You must sign this call with your application secret. Applications that should not include their application secret in their code (such as desktop applications), should not make this call.
member.param: An associative array containing key/value pairs, where the key is the ID of the user whose news you are clearing, and the value is the value is an array of news_ids you want to clear for that user. If you leave the news_ids value empty, then all news items get cleared for that user.
member.returns: This method returns one of the following: If you specified any news_ids, then this method returns an array of key/value pairs, where the key is the user ID and the value is a nested array of key/value pairs. In this second array, the key is a news_id and the value is a boolean indicating whether or not the news_id was cleared successfully. If you didn't specify any news_ids for the user, then this method returns a single array containing the user ID and a boolean indicating whether or not the news was cleared successfully.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.MultiGetNews(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Int64,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String}})
member.summary: This method returns your applications current set of personal news items for an array of users. This method does not take a session key. You must sign this call with your application secret. Applications that should not include their application secret in their code (such as desktop applications), should not make this call.
member.param: An associative array containing key/value pairs, where the key is the ID of the user whose news items you are retrieving, and the value is the value is an array of news_ids. If you leave the news_ids value empty, then all news items get returned for that user.
member.returns: This method returns an associative array containing key/value pairs, where the key is a user ID and the value is an object containing two keys: image: A URL to the image for this news item, or an empty string if the image doesn't exist. news: An array of one or more news item objects. For information about the contents of the news object, see dashboard.addNews.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.ClearGlobalNews(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64})
member.summary: This method removes all global news items previously set for your application or any global news items associated with a given news_id. Calling this method does not remove any existing personal news items you set for a specific user. To remove all news items for a given user, call this method and dashboard.clearNews. This method does not take a session key. You must sign this call with your application secret. Applications that should not include their application secret in their code (such as desktop applications), should not make this call.
member.param: An array of news_ids to clear. If you do not specify any news_ids, then all global news gets cleared for your application
member.returns: This method returns an array of key/value pairs, where the key is a news_id and the value is a boolean indicating whether or not the news item was cleared successfully

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.ClearNews(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64},System.Int64)
member.summary: This method removes some or all of your application's personal news items for a given user. Calling this method does not remove any existing global news items. To remove all news items for a given user, call this method and dashboard.clearGlobalNews.
member.param: An array of news_ids to clear. If you do not pass this parameter or specify any news_ids, then all personal news gets cleared for the specified user.
The ID of the user whose dashboard you are updating.
member.returns: This method returns an array of key/value pairs, where the key is a news_id and the value is a boolean indicating whether or not the news item was cleared successfully.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.DecrementCount(System.Int64)

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.SetCount(System.Int64,System.Int64)

member.param: The ID of the user whose counter you are incrementing.
The new value of the counter. The value must be an integer 0 or greater.
member.returns: This method returns true if the counter is set successfully. Otherwise, it returns false or an error code.

You should increment the counter only once for each item or action about which you need to notify a user.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.GetNews(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64},System.Int64)
member.summary: This method returns some or all of your application's personal news items for a given user, up to the limit. Facebook returns the 8 most recent arrays of news items, and each news item array can contain 8 individual news items, for a maximum of 64 news items in total.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.GetGlobalNews(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64})

member.param: An array of news_ids to return. If you do not specify any news_ids, then all global news gets returned.

For information about the contents of the news object, see dashboard.addGlobalNews.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.PublishActivity(FacebookToolkit.Schema.dashboard_bundle)
member.summary: This method posts one activity the current session user did in your application. Activities appear in the activity streams of the user's friends. You don't specify an image for activities; Facebook displays your application logo instead.
member.param: An object containing the following activity components: message (required): A text-only string containing the content of the activity. The message must also contain the {*actor*} token, which is the same token used in stream attachments. When the activity is published, Facebook replaces this token with the full name of the user whose session key you're using to made the call. You can also mention other users in the message. Use this syntax: @:USER_ID. When the activity is published, Facebook replaces the user ID with that user's full name. Note: The message gets truncated after 50 characters, including any user names referenced. action_link: An object containing one action link's text and URL. The action link appears after the message and follows the same guidelines as action links in stream stories. text: The text of the action link, which gets truncated after 25 characters. href: The URL of the action link.
member.returns: This method returns an int containing an activity_id if the call succeeds. Otherwise, it returns an error code.

member.returns: This method returns an int containing a news_id if the call succeeds

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.MultiAddNewsAsync(FacebookToolkit.Schema.dashboard_news,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64},FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.MultiAddNewsCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: This method adds personal news from your application for an array of users. Calling this method appends the news items included in this call to the news stream. Facebook displays up to two news items (either personal or global) at a time for a given application, starting from the two most recently added. This method does not take a session key. You must sign this call with your application secret. Applications that should not include their application secret in their code (such as desktop applications), should not make this call.
member.param: An array containing between 1 and 8 news item objects. Each news item object is an object that contains the following: message (required): This is a text-only string containing the content of the activity. You can include one {*actor*} token, which is the same token used in stream attachments. When the news is published, Facebook replaces this token with the full name of the current session user. Note: The message gets truncated after 50 characters, including any user name referenced. action_link: An associative array containing an action link text and URL. The action link appears after the message and follows the same guidelines as action links in stream stories. text: The text of the action link, which gets truncated after 25 characters. href: The URL of the action link. image:The absolute URL to the image associated with the array of news items. Facebook formats the image as a 64x64 pixel square. This image cannot be a Facebook.com URL. If you don't specify an image, Facebook displays your application logo instead.
An array of IDs of the users whose dashboards you are updating.
member.returns: This method returns an associative array of key/value pairs, where each key is the UID of the user whose news was set, and the value is either the ID of the news item, or false if the new wasn't set.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.MultiDecrementCountAsync(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64},FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.MultiDecrementCountCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: This method decreases your application's dashboard counter by 1 for an array of users. This method does not take a session key. You must sign this call with your application secret. Applications that should not include their application secret in their code (such as desktop applications), should not make this call.
member.param: An array of IDs of the users whose counters you are decrementing.
member.returns: This method returns an array of key/value pairs, where the key is the user ID and the value is a boolean indicating whether or not the counter was decremented successfully. Note: Decrementing a counter currently set to 0 will return false.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.MultiIncrementCountAsync(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64},FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.MultiIncrementCountCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: This method increases your application's dashboard counter by 1 for an array of users. As per the Platform Principles and Policy, you must use the counter only to inform users about legitimate actions that they should take within your application, and must not use the counter for promotional or marketing purposes. You should increment the counter only once for each item or action about which you need to notify a user. This method does not take a session key. You must sign this call with your application secret. Applications that should not include their application secret in their code (such as desktop applications), should not make this call.
member.param: An array of IDs of the users whose counters you are incrementing.
member.returns: This method returns an array of key/value pairs, where the key is user ID and the value is a boolean indicating whether or not the counter was incremented successfully.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.MultiGetCountAsync(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64},FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.MultiGetCountCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: This method returns the current value for your application's dashboard counter for an array of users. This method does not take a session key. You must sign this call with your application secret. Applications that should not include their application secret in their code (such as desktop applications), should not make this call.
member.param: An array of IDs of the users whose counters you are retrieving.
member.returns: This method returns an associative array containing key/value pairs, where the key is the user ID and the value is an int containing the current value for the counter.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.MultiSetCountAsync(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Int64,System.Int64},FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.MultiSetCountCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: This method sets your application's dashboard counter for an array of users. You can use this method to set a user's counter to 0, effectively clearing it. As per the Platform Principles and Policy, you must use the counter only to inform users about legitimate actions that they should take within your application, and must not use the counter for promotional or marketing purposes. You should increment the counter only once for each item or action about which you need to notify a user. This method does not take a session key. You must sign this call with your application secret. Applications that should not include their application secret in their code (such as desktop applications), should not make this call.
member.param: An array containing between 1 and 8 news item objects. Each news item object is an object that contains the following: message (required): This is a text-only string containing the content of the activity. You can include one {*actor*} token, which is the same token used in stream attachments. When the news is published, Facebook replaces this token with the full name of the current session user. Note: The message gets truncated after 50 characters, including any user name referenced. action_link: An associative array containing an action link text and URL. The action link appears after the message and follows the same guidelines as action links in stream stories. text: The text of the action link, which gets truncated after 25 characters. href: The URL of the action link. image:The absolute URL to the image associated with the array of news items. Facebook formats the image as a 64x64 pixel square. This image cannot be a Facebook.com URL. If you don't specify an image, Facebook displays your application logo instead.
member.returns: This method returns an array of key/value pairs, where the key is user ID and the value is a boolean indicating whether or not the counter was set successfully.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.MultiClearNewsAsync(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Int64,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String}},FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.MultiClearNewsCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: This method removes some or all of your application's personal news items for an array of users. Calling this method does not remove any existing global news items, so existing global news item(s) set with dashboard.addGlobalNews will appear again. To remove all news items for a user, call this method and dashboard.clearGlobalNews for each user. This method does not take a session key. You must sign this call with your application secret. Applications that should not include their application secret in their code (such as desktop applications), should not make this call.
member.param: An associative array containing key/value pairs, where the key is the ID of the user whose news you are clearing, and the value is the value is an array of news_ids you want to clear for that user. If you leave the news_ids value empty, then all news items get cleared for that user.
member.returns: This method returns one of the following: If you specified any news_ids, then this method returns an array of key/value pairs, where the key is the user ID and the value is a nested array of key/value pairs. In this second array, the key is a news_id and the value is a boolean indicating whether or not the news_id was cleared successfully. If you didn't specify any news_ids for the user, then this method returns a single array containing the user ID and a boolean indicating whether or not the news was cleared successfully.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.MultiGetNewsAsync(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Int64,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String}},FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.MultiGetNewsCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: This method returns your applications current set of personal news items for an array of users. This method does not take a session key. You must sign this call with your application secret. Applications that should not include their application secret in their code (such as desktop applications), should not make this call.
member.param: An associative array containing key/value pairs, where the key is the ID of the user whose news items you are retrieving, and the value is the value is an array of news_ids. If you leave the news_ids value empty, then all news items get returned for that user.
member.returns: This method returns an associative array containing key/value pairs, where the key is a user ID and the value is an object containing two keys: image: A URL to the image for this news item, or an empty string if the image doesn't exist. news: An array of one or more news item objects. For information about the contents of the news object, see dashboard.addNews.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.ClearGlobalNewsAsync(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64},FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.ClearGlobalNewsCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: This method removes all global news items previously set for your application or any global news items associated with a given news_id. Calling this method does not remove any existing personal news items you set for a specific user. To remove all news items for a given user, call this method and dashboard.clearNews. This method does not take a session key. You must sign this call with your application secret. Applications that should not include their application secret in their code (such as desktop applications), should not make this call.
member.param: An array of news_ids to clear. If you do not specify any news_ids, then all global news gets cleared for your application
member.returns: This method returns an array of key/value pairs, where the key is a news_id and the value is a boolean indicating whether or not the news item was cleared successfully

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.ClearNewsAsync(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64},System.Int64,FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.ClearNewsCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: This method removes some or all of your application's personal news items for a given user. Calling this method does not remove any existing global news items. To remove all news items for a given user, call this method and dashboard.clearGlobalNews.
member.param: An array of news_ids to clear. If you do not pass this parameter or specify any news_ids, then all personal news gets cleared for the specified user.
The ID of the user whose dashboard you are updating.
member.returns: This method returns an array of key/value pairs, where the key is a news_id and the value is a boolean indicating whether or not the news item was cleared successfully.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.DecrementCountAsync(System.Int64,FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.DecrementCountCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: This method decreases your application's dashboard counter by 1 for a given user, unless it's already set to 0.
member.param: The ID of the user whose counter you are decrementing.
member.returns: This method returns true if the counter is set successfully. Otherwise, it returns false or an error code.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.SetCountAsync(System.Int64,System.Int64,FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.SetCountCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: This method sets your application's dashboard counter for a given user. You can use this method to set a user's counter to 0, effectively clearing it.
member.param: The ID of the user whose counter you are incrementing.
The new value of the counter. The value must be an integer 0 or greater.
member.returns: This method returns true if the counter is set successfully. Otherwise, it returns false or an error code.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.IncrementCountAsync(System.Int64,FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.IncrementCountCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: This method increases your application's dashboard counter by 1 for a given user. As per the Platform Principles and Policy, you must use the counter only to inform users about legitimate actions that they should take within your application, and must not use the counter for promotional or marketing purposes. You should increment the counter only once for each item or action about which you need to notify a user.
member.param: The ID of the user whose counter you are incrementing.
member.returns: This method returns true if the counter is set successfully. Otherwise, it returns false or an error code.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.GetCountAsync(System.Int64,FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.GetCountCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: This method returns the current value for your application's dashboard counter for a given user.
member.param: The ID of the user whose counter you are retrieving
member.returns: This method returns an int containing the current value for the counter if the call succeeds. Otherwise, it returns an error code.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.GetActivityAsync(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64},System.Int64,FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.GetActivityCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: This method returns up to the 100 most recent application activities for the current user.
member.param: An array of activity_ids to return. If you do not specify any activity_ids, then the 100 most recent activities get returned for the current user.
The ID of the user whose dashboard you are updating.
member.returns: TThis method returns an array of activities, where each activity is an object containing a key/value pair, where the key is an activity_id and the value is a structure containing a message and action_link

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.RemoveActivityAsync(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64},FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.RemoveActivityCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: This method removes one or more of your application's activities for the current user.
member.param: An array of activity_ids to return. If you do not specify any activity_ids, then the 100 most recent activities get returned for the current user.
member.returns: This method returns an array of key/value pairs, where the key is an activity_id and the value is a boolean indicating whether or not the activity was cleared successfully.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.GetNewsAsync(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64},System.Int64,FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.GetNewsCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: This method returns some or all of your application's personal news items for a given user, up to the limit. Facebook returns the 8 most recent arrays of news items, and each news item array can contain 8 individual news items, for a maximum of 64 news items in total.
member.param: An array of news_ids to return. If you do not specify any news_ids, then all personal news (up to the limits specified above) gets returned for the specified user.
The ID of the user whose dashboard you are updating
member.returns: This method returns an array of news items, where each news item is an object containing two keys: image: A URL to the image for this news item, or an empty string if the image doesn't exist. news: An array of one or more news item objects. For information about the contents of the news object, see dashboard.addNews.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.GetGlobalNewsAsync(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64},FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.GetGlobalNewsCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: This method returns some or all of your application's global news items, up the limit. Facebook returns the 8 most recent arrays of news items, and each news item array can contain 8 individual news items, for a maximum of 64 news items in total.
member.param: An array of news_ids to return. If you do not specify any news_ids, then all global news gets returned.
member.returns: This method returns an array of news item objects, where each news item is a JSON-encoded object containing two keys: image: A URL to the image for this news item, or an empty string if the image doesn't exist. news: An array of one or more news item objects. For information about the contents of the news object, see dashboard.addGlobalNews.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.PublishActivityAsync(FacebookToolkit.Schema.dashboard_bundle,FacebookToolkit.Rest.Dashboard.PublishActivityCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: This method posts one activity the current session user did in your application. Activities appear in the activity streams of the user's friends. You don't specify an image for activities; Facebook displays your application logo instead.
member.param: An object containing the following activity components: message (required): A text-only string containing the content of the activity. The message must also contain the {*actor*} token, which is the same token used in stream attachments. When the activity is published, Facebook replaces this token with the full name of the user whose session key you're using to made the call. You can also mention other users in the message. Use this syntax: @:USER_ID. When the activity is published, Facebook replaces the user ID with that user's full name. Note: The message gets truncated after 50 characters, including any user names referenced. action_link: An object containing one action link's text and URL. The action link appears after the message and follows the same guidelines as action links in stream stories. text: The text of the action link, which gets truncated after 25 characters. href: The URL of the action link.
member.returns: This method returns an int containing an activity_id if the call succeeds. Otherwise, it returns an error code.

members.member:
This method is deprecated. Return all Marketplace listings either by listing ID or by user.
/// Filter by a list of users. If you leave this blank, then the list is filtered only for listing IDs. Filter by listing IDs. If you leave this blank, then the list is filtered only for user IDs. This method returns all visible listings matching the criteria given. If no matching listings are found, the method returns an empty element.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Marketplace.Search(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method is deprecated. Search Marketplace for listings filtering by category, subcategory and a query string.
member.param: Optional - the category to restirct search to, as returned by getCategories.
Optional - the subcategory to restrict search to, as returned by getSubcategories. If a subcategory is provided, a category is also necessary.
Optional - the textual query to search the listings data.
member.returns: Marketplace listings.
