member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Notifications.Get
member.summary: Returns a list of all of the visible notes written by the specified user.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Notifications.Get();

member.returns: This method returns the same set of subelements, whether or not there are outstanding notifications in any area. Note that if the unread subelement value is 0 for any of the pokes or shares elements, the most_recent element is also 0. Otherwise, the most_recent element contains an identifier for the most recent notification of the enclosing type.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Notifications.Send(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64},System.String)
member.summary: Sends a notification to a set of users.
member.param: List recipient IDs. These must be either friends of the logged-in user or people who have added your application. To send a notification to the current logged-in user without a name prepended to the message, set to_ids to empty List.

The content of the notification. The notification uses a stripped down version of FBML and HTML, allowing only text and links (see the list of allowed tags). The notification can contain up to 2,000 characters.
member.returns: This returns a list of user ids for whom notifications were successfully sent. We will throw an error if an error occurred.
member.remarks: The notification parameter is a very stripped-down set of FBML which allows only tags that result in just text and links.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Notifications.Send(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64},System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sends a notification to a set of users.
member.param: List recipient IDs. These must be either friends of the logged-in user or people who have added your application. To send a notification to the current logged-in user without a name prepended to the message, set to_ids to empty List.

The content of the notification. The notification uses a stripped down version of FBML and HTML, allowing only text and links (see the list of allowed tags). The notification can contain up to 2,000 characters.
Specify whether the notification is a user_to_user one or an app_to_user. (Default value is user_to_user.)
member.returns: This returns a list of user ids for whom notifications were successfully sent. We will throw an error if an error occurred.
member.remarks: The notification parameter is a very stripped-down set of FBML which allows only tags that result in just text and links.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Notifications.Send(System.String,System.String)

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Notifications.Send(Constants.UserId.ToString(), "my notification from samples app");

member.param: Comma-separated list of recipient IDs. These must be either friends of the logged-in user or people who have added your application. To send a notification to the current logged-in user without a name prepended to the message, set to_ids to empty List.

The content of the notification. The notification uses a stripped down version of FBML and HTML, allowing only text and links (see the list of allowed tags). The notification can contain up to 2,000 characters.

member.param: List recipient IDs. These must be either friends of the logged-in user or people who have added your application. To send a notification to the current logged-in user without a name prepended to the message, set to_ids to empty List.

The content of the notification. The notification uses a stripped down version of FBML and HTML, allowing only text and links (see the list of allowed tags). The notification can contain up to 2,000 characters.
Specify whether the notification is a user_to_user one or an app_to_user. (Default value is user_to_user.)

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Notifications.GetList(System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method gets all the current session user's notifications, as well as data for the applications that generated those notifications. It is a wrapper around the notification and application FQL tables; you can achieve more fine-grained control by using those two FQL tables in conjunction with the fql.multiquery API call. Applications must pass a valid session key.
member.param: Indicates the earliest time to return a notification. This equates to the updated_time field in the notification FQL table. If not specified, this call returns all available notifications.
Indicates whether to include notifications that have already been read. By default, notifications a user has read are not included.
member.returns: alerts and apps.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Notifications.MarkRead(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64})
member.summary: This method marks one or more notifications as read. You return the notifications by calling notifications.getList or querying the notification FQL table. Applications must pass a valid session key, and can only mark the notifications of the current session user.
member.param: List of notification ids
member.returns: if successful

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Notifications.SendEmail(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64},System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sends an email to the specified users who have the application.
member.param: A List of recipient IDs. The recipients must be people who have already added your application. You can email up to 100 people at a time.
The subject of the email message. As of 10/28/2008, the subject will accept a limited set of FBML tags, including names, and tags related to internationalization.

The plain text version of the email content. You must include a non-empty value for at least one of either the fbml or text parameters. The FBML input takes precedence, but if the given FBML value is invalid or cannot be rendered, then the text will be used instead. There is currently no character limit on the length of either the text or FBML body.

The FBML version of the email. You must include a non-empty value for at least one of either the fbml or text parameters. The fbml parameter is a stripped-down set of FBML that allows only HTML/FBML tags that result in text, links, linebreaks, as well as tags related to internationalization.
member.returns: This returns a comma-separated list of user ids for whom notifications were successfully sent. We will throw an error if an error occurred.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Fbml.RefreshImgSrc(System.String)
member.summary: Fetches and re-caches the image stored at the given URL.
member.param: The absolute URL from which to refresh the image.
member.returns: This method returns 1 if Facebook found a cached version of your image and successfully refreshed the image. It returns a blank response if Facebook was unable to find any previously cached version to refresh, or the image was unable to be re-fetched from your site and cached successfully. In such instances, whatever images were cached before remain as they were cached.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Fbml.RefreshRefUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Fetches and re-caches the content stored at the given URL.
member.param: The absolute URL from which to fetch content. This URL should be used in a fb:ref FBML tag.
member.returns: This method returns true if the content was fetched and re-cached from the specified URL.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Fbml.SetRefHandle(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Associates a given "handle" with FBML markup so that the handle can be used within the fb:ref FBML tag.
member.param: The handle to associate with the given FBML.
The FBML to associate with the given handle.
member.returns: This method returns true if the given handle was associated with FBML markup.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Fbml.UploadNativeStrings(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})

member.param: A collection of strings to translate. Each element of the collection is an object, with 'text' storing the actual string, 'description' storing the description of the text.
member.returns: If successful, this method returns the number of strings uploaded.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Fbml.DeleteCustomTags(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Deletes one or more custom tags you previously registered for the calling application with fbml.registerCustomTags.
member.param: A List of strings containing the names of the tags you want to delete. If this attribute is missing, all the application's custom tags will be deleted.
member.returns: This method returns true if custom tag deletes were successful.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Fbml.GetCustomTags
member.summary: Returns the custom tag definitions for tags that were previously defined using fbml.registerCustomTags.
member.returns: This method returns the custom tag definitions for previously defined tags.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Fbml.GetCustomTags(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the custom tag definitions for tags that were previously defined using fbml.registerCustomTags.
member.param: The ID of the application whose custom tags you want to get. If the ID is the calling application's ID, all the application's custom tags are returned. Otherwise, only the application's public custom tags are returned
member.returns: This method returns the custom tag definitions for previously defined tags.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Fbml.RegisterCustomTags(System.Collections.Generic.List{FacebookToolkit.Rest.CustomTag})
member.summary: Registers custom tags you can include in your that applications' FBML markup. Custom tags consist of FBML snippets that are rendered during parse time on the containing page that references the custom tag.
member.param: a List of CustomTag objects (See remarks for more detail.)
member.returns: This method returns the identifier of the custom tag.
member.remarks: Each tag object is an object with the following properties: name (required) (string): the name of the tag. The name must be a string up to 30 characters. Only letters, numbers, underscores ('_') and hyphens ('-') are allowed. type (optional) (string): Specify either leaf or container. Leaf tags can't contain any other tags (similar to <fb:name/>). Container tags may contain children between their open and close tags (like <fb:editor> </fb:editor>). (Default value is leaf.). description (optional) (string): A full description of the tag's functionality. This is used for documentation only, and is especially useful for public tags. is_public (optional) (string): Specify either true or false. Specifying true indicates that other applications can use this tag. You can have a mix of public and private tags within the same array. (Default value is false.). attributes (optional) (mixed): A list of attribute objects. Attributes are used to add dynamic elements to tags. The values of those attributes are substituted into the tag's FBML before it's parsed. Each attribute has the following fields: name (required) (string): The attribute's name. The name must be a string up to 30 characters in length. Only letters, numbers, underscores ('_') and hyphens ('-') are allowed. description (optional) (string): The attribute's description. This is used for documentation only, and is especially useful for public tags. default_value (optional) (string): The value to use when the attribute is missing. If an attribute doesn't have a default value, it is considered to be required and the developer will see an error message if the attribute is missing. fbml (required) (string): The FBML markup to substitute into the page where the tag is encountered. This property is required only for leaf tags. open_tag_fbml (required) (string): The FBML markup to substitute into the page where the open tag appears. This property is required for container tags only. close_tag_fbml (required) (string): The FBML markup to substitute into the page where the close tag appears. This property is required for container tags only. Note: Facebook recommends you do not include <script> tags in this FBML snippet. header_fbml: An FBML snippet that is rendered once on the page before the first tag that defined it. If multiple tags define the same value for header_fbml, and more than one of them appear on a page, then header_fbml is rendered only once. You should only use this for including CSS and initializing any JavaScript variables, not for rendering visible content. Facebook recommends you avoid including heavy JavaScript libraries and performing expensive JavaScript operations in header_fbml for performance reasons. Instead, use footer_fbml. footer_fbml: Similar to header_fbml, it's an FBML snippet that gets rendered after all custom tags are rendered. Facebook recommends you include heavy JavaScript libraries and perform any expensive JavaScript operations in footer_fbml, and avoid them in fbml, open_tag_fbml, close_tag_fbml, and header_fbml.

The values of those attributes are substituted into the tag's FBML before it's parsed. Each attribute has the following fields: name (required) (string): The attribute's name. The name must be a string up to 30 characters in length. Only letters, numbers, underscores ('_') and hyphens ('-') are allowed. description (optional) (string): The attribute's description. This is used for documentation only, and is especially useful for public tags. default_value (optional) (string): The value to use when the attribute is missing. If an attribute doesn't have a default value, it is considered to be required and the developer will see an error message if the attribute is missing. fbml (required) (string): The FBML markup to substitute into the page where the tag is encountered. This property is required only for leaf tags. open_tag_fbml (required) (string): The FBML markup to substitute into the page where the open tag appears. This property is required for container tags only. close_tag_fbml (required) (string): The FBML markup to substitute into the page where the close tag appears. This property is required for container tags only. Note: Facebook recommends you do not include <script> tags in this FBML snippet. header_fbml: An FBML snippet that is rendered once on the page before the first tag that defined it. If multiple tags define the same value for header_fbml, and more than one of them appear on a page, then header_fbml is rendered only once. You should only use this for including CSS and initializing any JavaScript variables, not for rendering visible content. Facebook recommends you avoid including heavy JavaScript libraries and performing expensive JavaScript operations in header_fbml for performance reasons. Instead, use footer_fbml. footer_fbml: Similar to header_fbml, it's an FBML snippet that gets rendered after all custom tags are rendered. Facebook recommends you include heavy JavaScript libraries and perform any expensive JavaScript operations in footer_fbml, and avoid them in fbml, open_tag_fbml, close_tag_fbml, and header_fbml.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Fbml.RefreshImgSrcAsync(System.String,FacebookToolkit.Rest.Fbml.RefreshImgSrcCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Fetches and re-caches the image stored at the given URL.
member.param: The absolute URL from which to refresh the image.
The AsyncCallback delegate
An object containing state information for this asynchronous request
member.returns: This method returns 1 if Facebook found a cached version of your image and successfully refreshed the image. It returns a blank response if Facebook was unable to find any previously cached version to refresh, or the image was unable to be re-fetched from your site and cached successfully. In such instances, whatever images were cached before remain as they were cached.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Data.SetUserPreference(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Sets currently authenticated user's preference.
member.param: (0-201) Numeric identifier of this preference.
(max. 128 characters) Value of the preference to set. Set it to "0" or "" to remove this preference.
member.remarks: Each preference is a string of maximum 128 characters and each of them has a numeric identifier ranged from 0 to 200. Therefore, every application can store up to 201 string values for each of its user. To "remove" a preference, set it to 0 or empty string. Both "0" and "" are considered as "not present", and getPreference() call will not return them. To tell them from each other, one can use some serialization format. For example, "n:0" for zeros and "s:" for empty strings.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Data.SetUserPreferences(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets currently authenticated user's preferences in batch. Each preference is a string of maximum 128 characters and each of them has a numeric identifier ranged from 0 to 200. Therefore, every application can store up to 201 string values for each of its user.
member.param: Id-value pairs of preferences to set. Each id is an integer between 0 and 200 inclusively. Each value is a string with maximum length of 128 characters. Use "0" or "" to remove a preference.
True to replace all existing preferences of this user; false to merge into existing preferences.
member.remarks: To "remove" a preference, set it to 0 or empty string. Both "0" and "" are considered as "not present", and getPreference() call will not return them. To tell them from each other, one can use some serialization format. For example, "n:0" for zeros and "s:" for empty strings.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Data.GetUserPreference(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets currently authenticated user's preference.
member.param: (0-200) Numeric identifier of the preference to get.
member.returns: This method returns the value of the specified preference. Empty string if the preference was not set, or it was set to "0" or empty string before.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Data.GetUserPreferences
member.summary: Gets currently authenticated user's preferences.
member.returns: This method returns a List of id-value pairs of preferences. For preferences that are set to 0 or empty strings, they will NOT show up in the returned map.
member.remarks: For return value: This is a problem if you identify the preferences by numbers on your machine. If a user fills out preference 0, 1, 2, and 4, but neglects to fill out preference 3 (because it may be optional) --> The array returned by this function will map preference 4 to 3. This preference will still be identified by 4 because each initial key in the returned array stores another array that would map 4 to the user preference, but you may have to iterate through each array until you find this missing preference depending on how many preferences you have and how many are missing.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Data.CreateObjectType(System.String)
member.summary: An object type is like a "table" in SQL terminology, or a "class" in object-oriented programming concepts. Each object type has a unique human-readable "name" that will be used to identify itself throughout the API. Each object type also has a list of properties that one has to define individually. Each property is like a "column" in an SQL table, or a "data member" in an object class.
member.param: Name of this new object type. This name needs to be unique among all object types and associations defined for this application. This name also needs to be a valid identifier, which is no longer than 32 characters, starting with a letter (a-z) and consisting of only small letters (a-z), numbers (0-9) and/or underscores.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Data.DefineAssociation(System.String,System.Int32,FacebookToolkit.Schema.assoc_object_type,FacebookToolkit.Schema.assoc_object_type,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: An object association is a directional relationship between two object identifiers. For example, Application Installation: user id => installed application ids; Marriage: husband => wife; Friendship: user id => friend user id; Gift: giver => receiver Each association has at least 3 names that are required to describe it: name of the association itself: "installation", "marriage", "friendship", "gift". alias1, name of the first object identifier: "user id", "husband", "giver". alias2, name of the second object identifier: "application id", "wife", "friend user id", "receiver". For some associations, we also need reverse direction for a lookup by the second object identifier. For examples, in "marriage" case, not only may we need to look up wife ids by husband ids, but we may also need to look up husband ids by wife ids. We call this a two-way association. Since "husband to wife" is not the same as "wife to husband", we call this a two-way asymmetric association. In some other two-way associations, backward association has the same meaning of forward association. For example, in "friendship", if "A is B's friend" then "B is A's friend" as well. We call these types of two-way associations symmetric. For a symmetric association, when "A to B" is added, we also add "B to A", so that a reverse lookup can find out exactly the same information.
member.param: Name of forward association to create. This name needs to be unique among all object types and associations defined for this application. This name also needs to be a valid identifier, which is no longer than 32 characters, starting with a letter (a-z) and consisting of only small letters (a-z), numbers (0-9) and/or underscores.

Type of this association: 1: one-way association, where reverse lookup is not needed; 2: two-way symmetric association, where a backward association (B to A) is always created when a forward association (A to B) is created. 3: two-way asymmetric association, where a backward association (B to A) has different meaning than a forward association (A to B).

Describes object identifier 1 in an association. This is a data structure that has: alias: name of object identifier 1. This alias needs to be a valid identifier, which is no longer than 32 characters, starting with a letter (a-z) and consisting of only small letters (a-z), numbers (0-9) and/or underscores. object_type: Optional - object type of object identifier 1. unique: Optional - Default to false. Whether each unique object identifier 1 can only appear once in all associations of this type.

Describes object identifier 2 in an association. This is a data structure that has: alias: name of object identifier 2. This alias needs to be a valid identifier, which is no longer than 32 characters, starting with a letter (a-z) and consisting of only small letters (a-z), numbers (0-9) and/or underscores. object_type: Optional - object type of object identifier 2. unique: Optional - Default to false. Whether each unique object identifier 2 can only appear once in all associations of this type.

Optional - name of backward association, if it is two-way asymmetric. This name needs to be unique among all object types and associations defined for this application. This name also needs to be a valid identifier, which is no longer than 32 characters, starting with a letter (a-z) and consisting of only small letters (a-z), numbers (0-9) and/or underscores.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Data.RenameAssociation(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Rename a previously defined association. Any renaming here only affects one direction. To change names and aliases for another direction, rename with the name of that direction of association.
member.param: Name of the association to change.

Optional - New name to use. This name needs to be unique among all object types and associations defined for this application. This name also needs to be a valid identifier, which is no longer than 32 characters, starting with a letter (a-z) and consisting of only small letters (a-z), numbers (0-9) and/or underscores.

Optional - New alias for object identifier 1 to use. This alias needs to be a valid identifier, which is no longer than 32 characters, starting with a letter (a-z) and consisting of only small letters (a-z), numbers (0-9) and/or underscores.

Optional - New alias for object identifier 2 to use. This alias needs to be a valid identifier, which is no longer than 32 characters, starting with a letter (a-z) and consisting of only small letters (a-z), numbers (0-9) and/or underscores.

member.summary: Get detailed definition of an association.
member.param: Name of the association.
member.returns: An object association information data structure that has: name: name of the association; * assoc_type: an integer indicating association's type: o 1: one-way association, where reverse lookup is not needed; o 2: two-way symmetric association, where a backward association (B to A) is always created when a forward association (A to B) is created. o 3: two-way asymmetric association, where a backward association (B to A) has different meaning than a forward association (A to B). * assoc_info1: object identifier 1's information: o alias: name of object identifier 1. o object_type: Optional - object type of object identifier 1. o unique: Whether each unique object identifier 1 can only appear once in all associations of this type. * assoc_info2: object identifier 2's information: o alias: name of object identifier 2. o object_type: Optional - object type of object identifier 2. o unique: Whether each unique object identifier 1 can only appear once in all associations of this type.

member.remarks: Each preference is a string of maximum 128 characters and each of them has a numeric identifier ranged from 0 to 200. Therefore, every application can store up to 201 string values for each of its user. To "remove" a preference, set it to 0 or empty string. Both "0" and "" are considered as "not present", and getPreference() call will not return them. To tell them from each other, one can use some serialization format. For example, "n:0" for zeros and "s:" for empty strings.

member.param: Id-value pairs of preferences to set. Each id is an integer between 0 and 200 inclusively. Each value is a string with maximum length of 128 characters. Use "0" or "" to remove a preference.
True to replace all existing preferences of this user; false to merge into existing preferences.

member.remarks: To "remove" a preference, set it to 0 or empty string. Both "0" and "" are considered as "not present", and getPreference() call will not return them. To tell them from each other, one can use some serialization format. For example, "n:0" for zeros and "s:" for empty strings.

member.param: (0-200) Numeric identifier of the preference to get.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Data.GetUserPreferencesAsync(FacebookToolkit.Rest.Data.GetUserPreferenceCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Gets currently authenticated user's preferences.
member.param: The AsyncCallback delegate
An object containing state information for this asynchronous request
member.returns: This method returns a List of id-value pairs of preferences. For preferences that are set to 0 or empty strings, they will NOT show up in the returned map.
member.remarks: For return value: This is a problem if you identify the preferences by numbers on your machine. If a user fills out preference 0, 1, 2, and 4, but neglects to fill out preference 3 (because it may be optional) --> The array returned by this function will map preference 4 to 3. This preference will still be identified by 4 because each initial key in the returned array stores another array that would map 4 to the user preference, but you may have to iterate through each array until you find this missing preference depending on how many preferences you have and how many are missing.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Data.DefineAssociationAsync(System.String,System.Int32,FacebookToolkit.Schema.assoc_object_type,FacebookToolkit.Schema.assoc_object_type,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},FacebookToolkit.Rest.Data.DefineAssociationCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: An object association is a directional relationship between two object identifiers. For example, Application Installation: user id => installed application ids; Marriage: husband => wife; Friendship: user id => friend user id; Gift: giver => receiver Each association has at least 3 names that are required to describe it: name of the association itself: "installation", "marriage", "friendship", "gift". alias1, name of the first object identifier: "user id", "husband", "giver". alias2, name of the second object identifier: "application id", "wife", "friend user id", "receiver". For some associations, we also need reverse direction for a lookup by the second object identifier. For examples, in "marriage" case, not only may we need to look up wife ids by husband ids, but we may also need to look up husband ids by wife ids. We call this a two-way association. Since "husband to wife" is not the same as "wife to husband", we call this a two-way asymmetric association. In some other two-way associations, backward association has the same meaning of forward association. For example, in "friendship", if "A is B's friend" then "B is A's friend" as well. We call these types of two-way associations symmetric. For a symmetric association, when "A to B" is added, we also add "B to A", so that a reverse lookup can find out exactly the same information.
member.param: Name of forward association to create. This name needs to be unique among all object types and associations defined for this application. This name also needs to be a valid identifier, which is no longer than 32 characters, starting with a letter (a-z) and consisting of only small letters (a-z), numbers (0-9) and/or underscores.

Type of this association: 1: one-way association, where reverse lookup is not needed; 2: two-way symmetric association, where a backward association (B to A) is always created when a forward association (A to B) is created. 3: two-way asymmetric association, where a backward association (B to A) has different meaning than a forward association (A to B).

Describes object identifier 1 in an association. This is a data structure that has: alias: name of object identifier 1. This alias needs to be a valid identifier, which is no longer than 32 characters, starting with a letter (a-z) and consisting of only small letters (a-z), numbers (0-9) and/or underscores. object_type: Optional - object type of object identifier 1. unique: Optional - Default to false. Whether each unique object identifier 1 can only appear once in all associations of this type.

Describes object identifier 2 in an association. This is a data structure that has: alias: name of object identifier 2. This alias needs to be a valid identifier, which is no longer than 32 characters, starting with a letter (a-z) and consisting of only small letters (a-z), numbers (0-9) and/or underscores. object_type: Optional - object type of object identifier 2. unique: Optional - Default to false. Whether each unique object identifier 2 can only appear once in all associations of this type.

Optional - name of backward association, if it is two-way asymmetric. This name needs to be unique among all object types and associations defined for this application. This name also needs to be a valid identifier, which is no longer than 32 characters, starting with a letter (a-z) and consisting of only small letters (a-z), numbers (0-9) and/or underscores.
The AsyncCallback delegate
An object containing state information for this asynchronous request

member.name: T:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Stream
member.summary: Facebook Stream API methods.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Stream.#ctor(FacebookToolkit.Session.FacebookSession)
member.summary: Public constructor for facebook.Stream
member.param: Needs a connected Facebook Session object for making requests

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Stream.AddComment(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method adds a comment to a post that was already published to a user's Wall.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new FBMLCanvasSession(Constants.WebApplicationKey, Constants.WebSecret)); var result = api.Stream.AddComment(Constants.PostId1, "adding a comment");

member.param: The ID for the post to which you're adding the comment.
The text of the comment. This is a plain text parameter only; you cannot format the comment with HTML or FBML.
member.returns: This call returns a comment_id if the comment was added successfully, or an error code if the call was unsuccessful.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Stream.AddComment(System.Int64,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method adds a comment to a post that was already published to a user's Wall.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new FBMLCanvasSession(Constants.WebApplicationKey, Constants.WebSecret)); var result = api.Stream.AddComment(Constants.UserId, Constants.PostId1, "adding a comment");

member.param: The user ID of the user adding the comment. If this parameter is not specified, then it defaults to the session user. Note: This parameter applies only to Web applications. Facebook ignores this parameter if it is passed by a desktop application.
The ID for the post to which you're adding the comment.
The text of the comment. This is a plain text parameter only; you cannot format the comment with HTML or FBML.
member.returns: This call returns a comment_id if the comment was added successfully, or an error code if the call was unsuccessful.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Stream.AddLike(System.String)
member.summary: This method lets a user add a like to any post the user can see. A user can like each post only once.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new FBMLCanvasSession(Constants.WebApplicationKey, Constants.WebSecret)); var result = api.Stream.AddLike(Constants.PostId1);

member.param: The ID of the post.
member.returns: This method returns true on success, or false and an error code if it fails.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Stream.AddLike(System.Int64,System.String)
member.summary: This method lets a user add a like to any post the user can see. A user can like each post only once.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new FBMLCanvasSession(Constants.WebApplicationKey, Constants.WebSecret)); var result = api.Stream.AddLike(Constants.UserId, Constants.PostId1);

member.param: The user ID of the user who likes the post. If this parameter is not specified, then it defaults to the session user. Note: This parameter applies only to Web applications. Facebook ignores this parameter if it is passed by a desktop application.
The ID of the post.
member.returns: This method returns true on success, or false and an error code if it fails.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Stream.Get(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64},System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: This method returns an object that contains the stream from the perspective of a specific viewer -- a user or a Facebook Page.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Stream.Get(null, DateTime.Now.AddYears(-2), DateTime.Now, 0);

member.param: An array containing all the stream data for the user profiles and Pages connected to the viewer_id. You can filter the stream to include posts by the IDs you specify here. (Default value is all connections of the viewer.)

The earliest DateTime for which to retrieve posts from the stream. The start_time uses the updated_time field in the stream (FQL) table as the baseline for determining the earliest time for which to get the stream.

The latest DateTime for which to retrieve posts from the stream. The end_time uses the updated_time field in the stream (FQL) table as the baseline for determining the latest time for which to get the stream.
The total number of posts to return. (Default value is 30 posts.)
member.returns: This method returns a stream_data object containing the following arrays: posts, which is an array of post data, containing the fields defined by the stream (FQL) table. profiles, which is an array of profile information, containing the fields defined by the profile (FQL) table. albums, which is an array of album information, containing the field as defined by the album (FQL) table.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Stream.Get(System.Int64,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64},System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String)
member.summary: This method returns an object that contains the stream from the perspective of a specific viewer -- a user or a Facebook Page.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Stream.Get(0, null, DateTime.Now.AddYears(-2), DateTime.Now, 0, null);

member.param: The user ID for whom you are fetching stream data. You can pass 0 for this parameter to retrieve publicly viewable information.

An array containing all the stream data for the user profiles and Pages connected to the viewer_id. You can filter the stream to include posts by the IDs you specify here. (Default value is all connections of the viewer.)

The earliest DateTime for which to retrieve posts from the stream. The start_time uses the updated_time field in the stream (FQL) table as the baseline for determining the earliest time for which to get the stream.

The latest DateTime for which to retrieve posts from the stream. The end_time uses the updated_time field in the stream (FQL) table as the baseline for determining the latest time for which to get the stream.
The total number of posts to return. (Default value is 30 posts.)

A filter associated with the user. Filters get returned by stream.getFilters or the stream_filter FQL table. To filter for stream posts from your application, look for a filter with a filter_key set to app_YOUR_APPLICATION_ID.
member.returns: This method returns a stream_data object containing the following arrays: posts, which is an array of post data, containing the fields defined by the stream (FQL) table. profiles, which is an array of profile information, containing the fields defined by the profile (FQL) table. albums, which is an array of album information, containing the field as defined by the album (FQL) table.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Stream.GetComments(System.String)
member.summary: This method returns all comments associated with a post in a user's stream. This method returns comments only if the user who owns the post (that is, the user published the post to his or her profile) has authorized your application.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new FBMLCanvasSession(Constants.WebApplicationKey, Constants.WebSecret)); var result = api.Stream.GetComments(Constants.PostId1);

member.param: The ID for the post for which you're retrieving the comments.
member.returns: This method returns a List of comments, where each comment contains the fields from the comment (FQL) table.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Stream.GetFilters
member.summary: This method returns any filters a user has specified for his or her home page stream.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Stream.GetFilters();

member.returns: This method returns a List of data containing the fields from the stream_filter_(FQL) table.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Stream.GetFilters(System.Int64)
member.summary: This method returns any filters a user has specified for his or her home page stream.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Stream.GetFilters(Constants.UserId);

member.param: The user ID for the user whose stream filters you are returning. Note: This parameter applies only to Web applications. Facebook ignores this parameter if it is passed by a desktop application.
member.returns: This method returns a List of data containing the fields from the stream_filter_(FQL) table.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Stream.Publish(System.String)
member.summary: This method publishes a post into the stream on the user's Wall and News Feed. This post also appears in the user's friends' streams (their News Feeds).

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Stream.Publish("Publishing to stream");

member.param: The message the user enters for the post at the time of publication.
member.returns: This call returns a post_id string containing the ID of the stream item upon success. If the call fails, it returns an error code instead.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Stream.Publish(System.String,FacebookToolkit.Rest.attachment,System.Collections.Generic.IList{FacebookToolkit.Schema.action_link},System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: This method publishes a post into the stream on the user's Wall and News Feed. This post also appears in the user's friends' streams (their News Feeds).
member.param: The message the user enters for the post at the time of publication.

An object containing the text of the post, relevant links, a media type (image, video, mp3, flash), as well as any other key/value pairs you may want to add. See Facebook API for more details. Note: If you want to use this call to update a user's status, don't pass an attachment; the content of the message parameter will become the user's new status and will appear at the top of the user's profile.
A List of action link objects, containing the link text and a hyperlink.

The ID of the user or the Page where you are publishing the content. If you specify a target_id, the post appears on the Wall of the target user, not on the Wall of the user who published the post. This mimics the action of posting on a friend's Wall on Facebook itself.

The user ID or Page ID of the user or Page publishing the post. If this parameter is not specified, then it defaults to the session user. Note: This parameter applies only to Web applications. Facebook ignores this parameter if it is passed by a desktop application.
member.returns: This call returns a post_id string containing the ID of the stream item upon success. If the call fails, it returns an error code instead.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Stream.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: This method removes a post from a user's Wall. The post also gets removed from the user's and the user's friends' News Feeds. Your application may only remove posts that were created through it.
member.returns: This call returns true if the post was removed, or false and an error code if the post was not removed.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Stream.Remove(System.Int64,System.String)
member.summary: This method removes a post from a user's Wall. The post also gets removed from the user's and the user's friends' News Feeds. Your application may only remove posts that were created through it.
member.param: The user ID of the user publishing the post. If this parameter is not specified, then it defaults to the session user. Note: This parameter applies only to Web applications. Facebook ignores this parameter if it is passed by a desktop application.
The ID for the post you want to remove.
member.returns: This call returns true if the post was removed, or false and an error code if the post was not removed.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Stream.RemoveComment(System.String)
member.summary: This method removes a comment from a post.
member.returns: This call returns true if the comment was removed, or false and an error code if the comment was not removed.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Stream.RemoveComment(System.Int64,System.String)
member.summary: This method removes a comment from a post.
member.param: The user ID of the user who made the comment. If this parameter is not specified, then it defaults to the session user. Note: This parameter applies only to Web applications. Facebook ignores this parameter if it is passed by a desktop application.
The ID for the comment you want to remove.
member.returns: This call returns true if the comment was removed, or false and an error code if the comment was not removed.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Stream.RemoveLike(System.String)
member.summary: This method removes a like a user added to a post.
member.param: The ID of the post.
member.returns: This method returns true on success, or false and an error code if it fails.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Stream.RemoveLike(System.Int64,System.String)
member.summary: This method removes a like a user added to a post.
member.param: The user ID of the user who liked the post. If this parameter is not specified, then it defaults to the session user. Note: This parameter applies only to Web applications. Facebook ignores this parameter if it is passed by a desktop application.
The ID of the post.
member.returns: This method returns true on success, or false and an error code if it fails.

member.param: The user ID of the user adding the comment. If this parameter is not specified, then it defaults to the session user. Note: This parameter applies only to Web applications. Facebook ignores this parameter if it is passed by a desktop application.
The ID for the post to which you're adding the comment.
The text of the comment. This is a plain text parameter only; you cannot format the comment with HTML or FBML.
The AsyncCallback delegate
An object containing state information for this asynchronous request
member.returns: This call returns a comment_id if the comment was added successfully, or an error code if the call was unsuccessful.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Stream.RemoveCommentAsync(System.String,FacebookToolkit.Rest.Stream.RemoveCommentCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: This method removes a comment from a post.
member.param: The ID for the comment you want to remove.
The AsyncCallback delegate
An object containing state information for this asynchronous request
member.returns: This call returns true if the comment was removed, or false and an error code if the comment was not removed.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Stream.RemoveCommentAsync(System.Int64,System.String,FacebookToolkit.Rest.Stream.RemoveCommentCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: This method removes a comment from a post.
member.param: The user ID of the user who made the comment. If this parameter is not specified, then it defaults to the session user. Note: This parameter applies only to Web applications. Facebook ignores this parameter if it is passed by a desktop application.
The ID for the comment you want to remove.
The AsyncCallback delegate
An object containing state information for this asynchronous request
member.returns: This call returns true if the comment was removed, or false and an error code if the comment was not removed.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Stream.RemoveAsync(System.String,FacebookToolkit.Rest.Stream.RemoveCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: This method removes a post from a user's Wall. The post also gets removed from the user's and the user's friends' News Feeds. Your application may only remove posts that were created through it.
member.param: The ID for the post you want to remove.
The AsyncCallback delegate
An object containing state information for this asynchronous request
member.returns: This call returns true if the post was removed, or false and an error code if the post was not removed.

member.param: The user ID of the user publishing the post. If this parameter is not specified, then it defaults to the session user. Note: This parameter applies only to Web applications. Facebook ignores this parameter if it is passed by a desktop application.
The ID for the post you want to remove.

An object containing state information for this asynchronous request
member.returns: This call returns true if the post was removed, or false and an error code if the post was not removed.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Links.Get
member.summary: Returns all links the user has posted on their profile through your application.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Links.Get();

member.returns: This method returns an List of link data.
member.remarks: For desktop applications, don't specify a uid; keep the default. (Default value is the logged-in user.)

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Message.GetThreadsInFolder(System.Int32,System.Int64,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns all of a user's messages and threads from the Inbox. The user needs to grant the calling application the read_mailbox extended permission. This method is a wrapper around the thread and message FQL tables; you can achieve more fine-grained control by using those two FQL tables in conjunction with the fql.multiquery API call. Applications must pass a valid session key or a user ID.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Message.GetThreadsInFolder(

member.param: The ID of the folder you want to return. The ID can be one of: 0 (for Inbox), 1 (for Outbox), or 4 (for Updates).
Indicates whether to include notifications that have already been read. By default, notifications a user has read are not included.
Indicates the number of threads to return.
Indicates how many threads to skip from the most recent thread.
member.returns: On success, returns an array of threads, where each contains an array of messages. Or else it returns an error code..

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Message.GetThreadsInFolderAsynch(System.Int32,System.Int64,System.Int32,System.Int32,FacebookToolkit.Rest.Message.GetThreadsInFolderCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Returns all of a user's messages and threads from the Inbox. The user needs to grant the calling application the read_mailbox extended permission. This method is a wrapper around the thread and message FQL tables; you can achieve more fine-grained control by using those two FQL tables in conjunction with the fql.multiquery API call. Applications must pass a valid session key or a user ID.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Message.GetThreadsInFolder(

member.param: The ID of the folder you want to return. The ID can be one of: 0 (for Inbox), 1 (for Outbox), or 4 (for Updates).
Indicates whether to include notifications that have already been read. By default, notifications a user has read are not included.
Indicates the number of threads to return.
Indicates how many threads to skip from the most recent thread.
The callback function if this is being called asynchronously.
The state of the object to return for the asynch call.
member.returns: On success, returns an array of threads, where each contains an array of messages. Or else it returns an error code..

member.name: T:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Message.GetThreadsInFolderCallback
member.summary: Delegate called when Send call is completed.
member.param: boolean result
An object containing state information for this asynchronous request
Exception object, if the call resulted in exception.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Permissions.GrantApiAccess(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: This method gives another application access to certain API calls on behalf of the application calling it. The application granted access is specified by permissions_apikey. Which methods or namespaces can be called are specified in method_arr.
member.param: The API key for the application that is being granted access.
JSON array of methods and/or namespaces for which the access is granted. If this is not specified, access to all allowed methods is granted.
member.returns: The method returns a bool value indicating whether the call succeeded or failed.
member.remarks: The only namespace that can be granted access at this time is admin.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Permissions.CheckAvailableApiAccess(System.String)
member.summary: This method returns the API methods to which access has been granted by the specified application.
member.param: The API key of the application for which the check is being done.
member.returns: The method returns an array of strings listing all methods/namespaces for which access is available.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Permissions.RevokeApiAccess(System.String)
member.summary: This method revokes the API access granted to the specified application.
member.param: The API key for the target application.
member.returns: The method returns a bool value indicating whether the call succeeded or failed.

member.returns: The method returns a List of strings listing all methods/namespaces for which access has been granted.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Video.GetUploadLimits
member.summary: Returns the file size and length limits for a video that the current user can upload through your application.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Video.GetUploadLimits();

member.returns: This method returns a video_limits object length and size keys mapped to the number of seconds and bytes, respectively.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Video.Upload(System.String,System.String,System.IO.FileInfo)
member.summary: Uploads a video owned by the current session user and returns the video.
member.param: The name of the video. The name cannot be longer than 65 characters. Longer titles will get truncated and will not return an error.
A description of the video. There is no limit to the length of the description.
The raw image data for the video.
member.returns: This method returns a video object containing information about the uploaded object.

member.name: T:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Comments
member.summary: Facebook Comments API methods.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Comments.#ctor(FacebookToolkit.Session.FacebookSession)
member.summary: Public constructor for facebook.Comments
member.param: Needs a connected Facebook Session object for making requests

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Comments.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Returns all comments for a given xid posted through fb:comments. This method is a wrapper for the FQL query on the comment FQL table.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Comments.Get("xid_test");

member.param: The comment xid that you want to retrieve. For a Comments Box, you can determine the xid on the admin panel or in the application settings editor in the Facebook Developer application.
member.returns: This method returns all comments for a given xid.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Comments.Add(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a comment for a given xid on behalf of a user. Calls with a session secret may only act on behalf of the session user.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Comments.Add("xid_test", "test");

member.param: The xid of a particular Comments Box or fb:comments.
The comment/text to be added, as inputted by a user.
member.returns: This call returns a comment_id if the comment was added successfully, or an error code if the call was unsuccessful.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Comments.Add(System.String,System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: Adds a comment for a given xid on behalf of a user. Calls with a session secret may only act on behalf of the session user.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Comments.Add("xid_test", "test", Constants.UserId);

member.param: The xid of a particular Comments Box or fb:comments.
The comment/text to be added, as inputted by a user.
The user ID to add a comment on behalf of. This defaults to the session user and must only be the session user if using a session secret (example: Desktop and JSCL apps).
member.returns: This call returns a comment_id if the comment was added successfully, or an error code if the call was unsuccessful.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Comments.Add(System.String,System.String,System.Int64,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a comment for a given xid on behalf of a user. Calls with a session secret may only act on behalf of the session user.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Comments.Add("xid_test", "test", Constants.UserId, "comment title", "http://www.facebook.com", false);

member.param: The xid of a particular Comments Box or fb:comments.
The comment/text to be added, as inputted by a user.
The user ID to add a comment on behalf of. This defaults to the session user and must only be the session user if using a session secret (example: Desktop and JSCL apps).
The title associated with the item the user is commenting on. This is required if publishing a feed story as it provides the text of the permalink to give context to the user's comment.
The url associated with the item the user is commenting on. This is required if publishing a feed story as it is the permalink associated with the comment.
Whether a feed story should be published about this comment. This defaults to false and can only be 'true' if the user has granted the publish_stream extended permission.
member.returns: This call returns a comment_id if the comment was added successfully, or an error code if the call was unsuccessful.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Comments.Remove(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes a comment for a given xid by comment_id. Calls with a session secret may only act on behalf of the session user.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Comments.Remove("xid_test", 174967);

member.param: The xid of a particular Comments Box or fb:comments.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Comments.AddAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Int64,FacebookToolkit.Rest.Comments.AddCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a comment for a given xid on behalf of a user. Calls with a session secret may only act on behalf of the session user.
member.param: The xid of a particular Comments Box or fb:comments.
The comment/text to be added, as inputted by a user.
The user ID to add a comment on behalf of. This defaults to the session user and must only be the session user if using a session secret (example: Desktop and JSCL apps).
The AsyncCallback delegate
An object containing state information for this asynchronous request
member.returns: This call returns a comment_id if the comment was added successfully, or an error code if the call was unsuccessful.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Comments.AddAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Int64,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,FacebookToolkit.Rest.Comments.AddCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a comment for a given xid on behalf of a user. Calls with a session secret may only act on behalf of the session user.
member.param: The xid of a particular Comments Box or fb:comments.
The comment/text to be added, as inputted by a user.
The user ID to add a comment on behalf of. This defaults to the session user and must only be the session user if using a session secret (example: Desktop and JSCL apps).
The title associated with the item the user is commenting on. This is required if publishing a feed story as it provides the text of the permalink to give context to the user's comment.
The url associated with the item the user is commenting on. This is required if publishing a feed story as it is the permalink associated with the comment.
Whether a feed story should be published about this comment. This defaults to false and can only be 'true' if the user has granted the publish_stream extended permission.
The AsyncCallback delegate
An object containing state information for this asynchronous request
member.returns: This call returns a comment_id if the comment was added successfully, or an error code if the call was unsuccessful.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Profile.#ctor(FacebookToolkit.Session.FacebookSession)
member.summary: Public constructor for facebook.Profile
member.param: Needs a connected Facebook Session object for making requests

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Profile.GetFBML(System.Int64,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the FBML that is currently set for a user's profile.
member.param: The user whose profile FBML is to be fetched, or the page ID in case of a Page. This parameter applies only to Web applications and is required by them only if the session_key is not specified. Facebook ignores this parameter if it is passed by a desktop application.
The type of profile box to retrieve. Specify 1 for the original style (wide and narrow column boxes), 2 for profile_main box. (default value is 1)
member.returns: The FBML markup from the user's profile.
member.remarks: It is not a violation of Facebook Privacy policy if you use this method to retrieve content originally rendered by your application from a user's profile, even if Facebook privacy restrictions would otherwise keep you from seeing that users profile (for example, you are not friends with the user in question). Cases where this would arise include verifying content posted by one user of your application to another users profile complies with the Facebook Developer Terms of Service.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Profile.SetFBML(System.Int64,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the FBML for a user's profile, including the content for both the profile box and the profile actions.
member.param: The user whose profile is to be updated. Not allowed for desktop applications (since the application secret is essentially public).
The FBML intended for the application profile box on the user's profile.
The FBML intended for the narrow profile box on the Wall tab of the user's profile.
The FBML intended for mobile devices.
member.returns: This method returns true if FBML was set for a profile.
member.remarks: The FBML is cached on Facebook's server for that particular user and that particular application. To change it, profile.setFBML must be called through a canvas page or some other script (such as a cron job) that makes use of the Facebook API.

member.returns: This method returns a user_info object for the specified uid.

member.summary: Configures an application info section that the specified user can install on the Info tab of her profile.
member.param: The title or header of the application info section.
Specify 1 for a text-only field-item configuration or 5 for a thumbnail configuration.

A List of elements comprising an application info section, including the field (the title of the field) and an array of info_item objects (each object has a label and a link, and optionally contains image, description, and sublabel fields).
The user ID of the user adding the application info section.
member.returns: This method returns true if the application info section was successfully set.

member.summary: Specifies the objects for a field for an application info section.

A List of items for a thumbnail, including a label and a link, and optionally contains image, description, and sublabel items.
member.returns: This method returns true if the available items for a filed in an application info section was successfully set.

member.name: T:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Groups
member.summary: Facebook Groups API methods.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Groups.#ctor(FacebookToolkit.Session.FacebookSession)
member.summary: Public constructor for facebook.Groups
member.param: Needs a connected Facebook Session object for making requests

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Groups.Get
member.summary: Returns all visible groups according to the filters specified. This may be used to find all groups of which a user is as member, or to query specific gids.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Groups.Get();

member.returns: This method returns all groups satisfying the filters specified. The method can be used to return all groups associated with user, or query a specific set of events by a list of gids. If both the uid and gids parameters are provided, the method returns all groups in the set of gids, with which the user is associated. If the gids parameter is omitted, the method returns all groups associated with the provided user.
member.remarks: Group creators will be visible to an application only if the creator has not turned off access to the Platform or used the application'; If the creator has opted out, the creator element will appear as nil=true.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Groups.Get(System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns all visible groups according to the filters specified. This may be used to find all groups of which a user is as member, or to query specific gids.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Groups.Get(Constants.UserId);

member.param: Filter by groups associated with a user with this uid
member.returns: This method returns all groups satisfying the filters specified. The method can be used to return all groups associated with user, or query a specific set of events by a list of gids. If both the uid and gids parameters are provided, the method returns all groups in the set of gids, with which the user is associated. If the gids parameter is omitted, the method returns all groups associated with the provided user.
member.remarks: Group creators will be visible to an application only if the creator has not turned off access to the Platform or used the application'; If the creator has opted out, the creator element will appear as nil=true.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Groups.Get(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64})
member.summary: Returns all visible groups according to the filters specified. This may be used to find all groups of which a user is as member, or to query specific gids.
member.param: Filter by this list of group ids. This is a List of gids.
member.returns: This method returns all groups satisfying the filters specified. The method can be used to return all groups associated with user, or query a specific set of events by a list of gids. If both the uid and gids parameters are provided, the method returns all groups in the set of gids, with which the user is associated. If the gids parameter is omitted, the method returns all groups associated with the provided user.
member.remarks: Group creators will be visible to an application only if the creator has not turned off access to the Platform or used the application'; If the creator has opted out, the creator element will appear as nil=true.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Groups.Get(System.Int64,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64})
member.summary: Returns all visible groups according to the filters specified. This may be used to find all groups of which a user is as member, or to query specific gids.
member.param: Filter by groups associated with a user with this uid
Filter by this list of group ids. This is a List of gids.
member.returns: This method returns all groups satisfying the filters specified. The method can be used to return all groups associated with user, or query a specific set of events by a list of gids. If both the uid and gids parameters are provided, the method returns all groups in the set of gids, with which the user is associated. If the gids parameter is omitted, the method returns all groups associated with the provided user.
member.remarks: Group creators will be visible to an application only if the creator has not turned off access to the Platform or used the application'; If the creator has opted out, the creator element will appear as nil=true.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Admin.GetMetrics(System.DateTime,System.DateTime,FacebookToolkit.Rest.Admin.Period)
member.summary: Returns specified metrics for your application, given a time period.
member.param: A DateTime for the start of the range (inclusive).
A DateTime time for the end of the range (inclusive). The end_time cannot be more than 30 days after the start_time.
The length of the period, in seconds, during which the metrics were collected. Currently, the only supported periods are 86400 (1 day), 604800 (7-days), and 2592000 (30 days).
member.returns: This method returns the metrics specified for the given range and time period.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Events.Get(System.Nullable{System.Int64},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int64},System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.String)
member.summary: Returns all visible events according to the filters specified. This may be used to find all events of a user, or to query specific eids.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Events.Get(Constants.UserId, new List<long> { Constants.EventId }, new DateTime(2000, 1, 1), DateTime.Now.AddYears(1), "attending");

member.param: Filter by events associated with a user with this uid.
Filter by this list of event ids. This is a comma-separated list of eids.
Filter with this UTC as lower bound. A missing or zero parameter indicates no lower bound.
Filter with this UTC as upper bound. A missing or zero parameter indicates no upper bound.
Filter by this RSVP status. attending,unsure,declined,not_replied
member.returns: This method returns all events satisfying the filters specified. The method can be used to return all events associated with user, or query a specific set of events by a list of eids.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Events.Cancel(System.Int64,System.String)
member.summary: Cancels an event. The application must be an admin of the event.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Events.Cancel(Constants.EventId, "cancel message");

member.param: The event ID.
The message sent explaining why the event was canceled. You can pass an empty string if you don't want to provide an explanation.
member.returns: This method returns true if the Cancel is successful.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Events.Create(FacebookToolkit.Schema.facebookevent)
member.summary: Creates an event on behalf of the user if the application has an active session; otherwise it creates an event on behalf of the application.
member.param: The event information. See the Facebook API Notes for information on what parameters to include in the object.
member.returns: This method returns the identifier of the created event.
member.remarks:
Create an event - You must pass the following parameters in the event_info array: name category subcategory location start_time end_time The start_time and end_time are the times that were input by the event creator, converted to UTC after assuming that they were in Pacific time (Daylight Savings or Standard, depending on the date of the event), then converted into Unix epoch time.
Optionally, you can pass the following parameters in the event_info array:
street phone email host_id host desc privacy_type tagline

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Events.Edit(System.Int64,FacebookToolkit.Schema.facebookevent)
member.summary: Edits an existing event. The application must be an admin of the event.
member.param: The event ID.
The event information. See the Facebook API Notes for information on what parameters to include in the object.
member.returns: This method returns true if successful, or an error code otherwise.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Events.Rsvp(System.Int64,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the attendance option for the current user.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Events.Rsvp(Constants.EventId, "attending");

member.param: The event ID.
The user's RSVP status. Specify attending, unsure, or declined.
member.returns: This method returns true if successful.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Events.GetMembers(System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns membership list data associated with an event.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Events.GetMembers(Constants.EventId);

member.param: The event ID.
member.returns: This method returns four (possibly empty) lists of users associated with an event, keyed on their RSVP statuses. These lists should never share any members.

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Events.CancelAsync(System.Int64,System.String,FacebookToolkit.Rest.Events.CancelEventCallback,System.Object)

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Events.CreateAsync(FacebookToolkit.Schema.facebookevent,FacebookToolkit.Rest.Events.CreateEventCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Creates an event on behalf of the user if the application has an active session; otherwise it creates an event on behalf of the application.
member.param: The event information. See the Facebook API Notes for information on what parameters to include in the object.
The AsyncCallback delegate
An object containing state information for this asynchronous request
member.returns: This method returns the identifier of the created event.
member.remarks:
Create an event - You must pass the following parameters in the event_info array: name category subcategory location start_time end_time The start_time and end_time are the times that were input by the event creator, converted to UTC after assuming that they were in Pacific time (Daylight Savings or Standard, depending on the date of the event), then converted into Unix epoch time.
Optionally, you can pass the following parameters in the event_info array:
street phone email host_id host desc privacy_type tagline

member.name: M:FacebookToolkit.Rest.Status.Set(System.String)
member.summary: Updates a user's Facebook status through your application. This is a streamlined version of users.setStatus.

example.code: Api api = new Api(new DesktopSession(Constants.ApplicationKey, Constants.ApplicationSecret, Constants.SessionSecret, Constants.SessionKey)); var result = api.Status.Set("Setting a test status.");

member.param: The status message to set. Note: The maximum message length is 255 characters; messages longer than that limit will be truncated and appended with '...'.
member.returns: This method returns true on success, false on failure, or an error code.
member.remarks: Pass in 0 if you want the logged in user or the default of 100 messages
